Just got the Jan 05 NCJSC "To-Ron" and have a question
about the tsuba at the bottom of page 3 - the Ho bird over
paulownia.

What school is this? The elongated hitsu-ana and other work
makes me think Saotome. What appears to be the acid etched
design makes me think Hoan but Saotome also did that style
work.

I wish the publisher would be sure to include translations
and/or attributions for all the photos in To-Ron. It would
really be very helpful.

Rich S
